meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the kids were knackered and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: She felt knackered after staying up late studying for her exams.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked knackered after chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: The old car sputtered to a stop, knackered from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was so knackered that even lifting a finger seemed impossible.

meanings.sent1: The knackered toy could no longer be played with safely.
meanings.sent2: The knackered chair creaked loudly whenever someone sat on it.
meanings.sent3: The knackered umbrella flipped inside out at the first gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The knackered phone screen was covered in cracks from being dropped.
meanings.sent5: The knackered door handle fell off in my hand when I tried to open it.

meanings.definition: Ruined or no longer functioning properly.
meanings.sent1: The knackered computer kept freezing and crashing.
meanings.sent2: The knackered clock no longer kept time accurately.
meanings.sent3: The knackered TV only showed static on every channel.
meanings.sent4: The knackered bike chain kept slipping off during the ride.
meanings.sent5: The knackered flashlight flickered and dimmed with each use.
